meanings.definition: Neglect or failure to fulfill a duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: Her misprision of her responsibilities led to chaos in the office.
meanings.sent2: The misprision of the teacher to grade the papers caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: The misprision of the dog to guard the house resulted in a messy living room.
meanings.sent4: The misprision of the sun to shine brightly on the wedding day made the ceremony even more magical.
meanings.sent5: The misprision of the alarm clock to ring on time made her late for work.

meanings.sent1: His misprision of her words led to unnecessary arguments.
meanings.sent2: The misprision of the text message caused confusion between the friends.
meanings.sent3: The misprision of the recipe made the cake turn out salty instead of sweet.
meanings.sent4: The misprision of the map led them to the wrong destination.
meanings.sent5: The misprision of the weather forecast resulted in unexpected rain during the picnic.

meanings.definition: Concealment or neglect of knowledge of a crime.
meanings.sent1: His misprision of the theft in the store made him an accomplice.
meanings.sent2: The misprision of the witness to speak up in court hindered justice.
meanings.sent3: The misprision of the cat to hide the toy under the bed amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The misprision of the moon to hide behind the clouds created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The misprision of the tree to conceal the bird's nest intrigued the nature enthusiasts.
